House Tassel: Victor Horta, Brussels, 1893
Metro Stations: Hector Guimard, Paris, 1900
Parc Guëll: Antonio Gaudì, Barcelona, (1900 - 1914)
Casa Mila: Antonio Gaudì, Barcelona, (1905 - 1910)
Sagrada Familia: Antonio Gaudì, Barcelona, 1883
Stock Exchange: Hendrik Petrus Berlage, Amsterdam, (1897 - 1898)
Glasgow School of Art: Charles Rennie Mackintosh, Glasgow, (1896 - 1899), (1906 - 1909)
Willow Tea Rooms: Charles Rennie Mackintosh, Glasgow, 1903
Hill House: Charles Rennie Mackintosh, Helensburgh, Scotland, (1902 - 1904)
"Majolikahaus": Otto Wagner, Vienna, (1898 - 1899)
Secession Building: Ernst Maria Olbrich, Vienna, (1897 - 1898)
Postal Savings Bank: Otto Wagner, Vienna, (1904 - 1906)
Goldman and Salatsch Tailorshop: Adolf Loos, Vienna, (1908 - 1910)
Haus Steiner: Adolf Loos, Vienna, 1910
School of Art: Henry van de Velde, Weimar, 1904
AEG Turbine Factory: Peter Behrens, Berlin, 1909
Fagus Factory: Walter Gropius and Adolf Meyer, Alfeld, Germany, 1911
Monadnock Building: Burnham and Root, Chicago, (1891 - 1893)
Wainwright Building: Dankmar Adler and Louis Sullivan, St. Louis, (1890 - 1891)
Guaranty Building: Dankmar Adler and Louis Sullivan, Buffalo, (1894 - 1895)
Wright Home and Studio: Frank Lloyd Wright, Oak Park, IL, 1889
Ward Willits House: Frank Lloyd Wright, Highland Park, IL, 1902
Larkin Building: Frank Lloyd Wright, Buffalo, (1904 - 1906)
Unity Temple: Frank Lloyd Wright, Oak Park, IL, 1906
Robie House: Frank Lloyd Wright, Chicago, 1909
Imperial Hotel: Frank Lloyd Wright, Tokyo, Japan, (1915 - 1922)
Cittá Nuova: Antonio Sant'Elia, Project, 1914
Glass Pavilion: Bruno Taut, Cologne, 1914
Schröder House: Gerrit Rietveld, Utrecht, 1924
Friedrichstrasse Skyscraper: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, Project, 1921
Concrete Office Building: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, Project, 1923
Bauhaus: Walter Gropius, Dessau, 1926
Masters‘ houses: Walter Gropius, Carl Fieger, Ernst Neufert, Dessau, Bauhaus Building, 1926
Tugendhat House: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, Brno, (1928 - 1930)
Exhibition Pavilion: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, Barcelona, 1929
"Cloud Hanger": El Lissitzky, Project, 1925
Tower for the III International in Moscow: Vladimir Tatlin, Project, (1919 - 1920)
